discussion_comments.comment_body:
GitHub in its infinite wisdom won't let me comment on `render: text` specifically, but this should probably be discussed properly again.

Quite a few people seem to be editing their Discussion to make this use Markdown, and in its current state headings can't be larger and there is no syntax highlighting.

But, if this were converted to a Markdown box, something like the following would probably be needed:
> Make sure to wrap all configuration in code blocks with three back ticks on separate lines.

Because I'm not entirely trusting that people are going to do it by themselves.  And nothing's worse than
# foo bar baz
abc = no
# the quick brown fox
# i love comments omg
a = {
    b = {
        c = {
            d = "```"
        }
        e = "```"
}
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<match target="pattern">
    <test name="family" qual="any">
        <string>monospace</string>
    </test>
    <edit mode="prepend" name="family">
        <string>JetBrains Mono</string>
    </edit>
</match>

And the rest of the template being completely destroyed.

-----

Here's the above “configuration” in a code block, just to show how much was messed up:
````
# foo bar baz
abc = no
# the quick brown fox
# i love comments omg
a = {
    b = {
        c = {
            d = "```"
        }
        e = "```"
}
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<match target="pattern">
    <test name="family" qual="any">
        <string>monospace</string>
    </test>
    <edit mode="prepend" name="family">
        <string>JetBrains Mono</string>
    </edit>
</match>
````
